page.title: 17FOSTERING CHILDREN
page.content: Fostering is providing a home for a child or children who for some reason cannot be with their own parents eg. because of illness, death or physical abuse. The local authority place these children into foster homes, and an allowance is paid accordingly to the needs of the child. We took a boy who had been locked up while his parents went drinking. It was a long time before he settled and would play with a door shut. Another child would often be found sleeping on the stairs, having crept down long after we'd tucked her up in bed, fearing we'd left while she was sleeping. These children have moved on but it is important to them and others that they are welcomed both in the foster home and the community. We find the people of Dolphinton very helpful towards us in this respect.
